idata.python:
# New TunePad cell
# Define notes for the upbeat melody, in the key of C major
C5, D5, E5, G5, A5, F5 = 72, 74, 76, 79, 81, 77  # Higher notes for an energetic melody
C4, G4, F4 = 60, 67, 65  # Lower notes for chordal support

# Define an upbeat melody function
def upbeat_melody():
    playNote(C5, beats=0.5)  # Fast and energetic start
    playNote(E5, beats=0.5)
    playNote(G5, beats=0.5)  # Quick rising melody
    playNote(A5, beats=0.5)
    rest(0.5)  # Short rest to keep it bouncy

    playNote(C5, beats=0.5)  # Repeating the energetic motif
    playNote(D5, beats=0.5)
    playNote(E5, beats=0.5)
    playNote(F5, beats=0.5)  # Quick, playful notes
    rest(0.5)

    playNote(G5, beats=0.5)
    playNote(A5, beats=0.5)
    playNote(G5, beats=0.5)
    playNote(F5, beats=0.5)
    rest(0.5)

    playNote(C4, beats=1)  # Resolving the melody with a lower note
    playNote(C5, beats=1)
    rest(1)

# Execute the upbeat melody
upbeat_melody()

# New TunePad cell
# Define complementary notes for the secondary upbeat melody
B4, D5, F5, A5, E5, G5, = 71, 74, 77, 81, 76, 79  # Harmonizing notes in the key of C major
G4, F4, = 67, 65  # Lower notes for added variation

# Define the complementary upbeat melody function
def upbeat_secondary_melody():
    playNote(G5, beats=0.5)  # Syncopated start for a lively effect
    playNote(B4, beats=0.5)
    playNote(D5, beats=0.5)
    playNote(F5, beats=0.5)
    rest(0.25)  # Small rest for rhythm variation

    playNote(A5, beats=0.5)  # Continuing with bright, ascending notes
    playNote(G5, beats=0.5)
    playNote(E5, beats=0.5)
    playNote(D5, beats=0.5)
    rest(0.25)

    playNote(F5, beats=0.5)
    playNote(E5, beats=0.5)
    playNote(D5, beats=0.5)
    rest(0.5)

    playNote(G4, beats=1)  # Resolve with lower notes to contrast the main melody
    playNote(F4, beats=1)
    rest(1)

# Execute the complementary upbeat melody
upbeat_secondary_melody()

idata.python:
# New TunePad cell
# Define notes for the guitar accompaniment in the key of C major
C4, E4, G4, A4, F4, D4 = 60, 64, 67, 69, 65, 62  # Chordal and bass notes for accompaniment

# Define the upbeat guitar accompaniment function
def guitar_accompaniment():
    # Start with a bright C major chord
    playNote(C4, beats=0.5)
    playNote(E4, beats=0.5)
    playNote(G4, beats=0.5)
    rest(0.5)  # Quick pause

    # Move to an F major chord for a shift
    playNote(F4, beats=0.5)
    playNote(A4, beats=0.5)
    playNote(C4, beats=0.5)
    rest(0.5)

    # Play a G major chord with a bit of energy
    playNote(G4, beats=0.5)
    playNote(D4, beats=0.5)
    rest(0.5)

    # Return to C major to close out the progression
    playNote(C4, beats=0.5)
    playNote(E4, beats=0.5)
    playNote(G4, beats=0.5)
    rest(1)

# Execute the guitar accompaniment
guitar_accompaniment()

# New TunePad cell
# Define notes for the guitar accompaniment in the key of C major
C4, E4, G4, A4, F4, D4, B4, C5, = 60, 64, 67, 69, 65, 62, 71, 72  # Notes for bright, upbeat guitar chords

# Define the enhanced upbeat guitar accompaniment function
def upbeat_guitar_accompaniment():
    # Quick C major strum with added high note for extra energy
    playNote(C4, beats=0.25)
    playNote(E4, beats=0.25)
    playNote(G4, beats=0.25)
    playNote(C5, beats=0.25)  # Higher octave for brightness
    rest(0.25)  # Quick rest for bounce

    # F major strum with variation to keep it lively
    playNote(F4, beats=0.25)
    playNote(A4, beats=0.25)
    playNote(C5, beats=0.25)
    playNote(F4, beats=0.25)  # Echo note for rhythmic interest
    rest(0.25)

    # G major strum with an extra high note for energy
    playNote(G4, beats=0.25)
    playNote(B4, beats=0.25)
    playNote(D4, beats=0.25)
    rest(0.25)

    # Return to C major with added rhythm and harmony
    playNote(C4, beats=0.25)
    playNote(E4, beats=0.25)
    playNote(G4, beats=0.25)
    playNote(C5, beats=0.25)
    rest(0.5)
    
    playNote(C4, beats=0.25)

    playNote(A4, beats=0.25)

    playNote(F4, beats=0.25)  # Echo note for rhythmic interest

    # G major strum with an extra high note for energy

    playNote(B4, beats=0.25)

    rest(0.25)

    # Return to C major with added rhythm and harmony

    playNote(G4, beats=0.25)
    rest(0.5)
    
    playNote(C4, beats=0.25)
    playNote(E4, beats=0.25)
    playNote(G4, beats=0.25)
    playNote(C5, beats=0.25)  # Higher octave for brightness
    rest(0.25)  # Quick rest for bounce
    
    # Execute the upbeat guitar accompaniment

# New TunePad cell
# Define bass notes in the key of C major
C3, E3, F3, G3, A3 = 48, 52, 53, 55, 57  # Bass notes for rhythm and groove

# Define the fun, upbeat bassline function
def upbeat_bassline():
    # Start with a bouncy C bass note pattern
    playNote(C3, beats=0.5)
    playNote(G3, beats=0.25)
    playNote(C3, beats=0.25)
    rest(0.25)  # Short pause for syncopation

    # Move to F for a bit of variety and depth
    playNote(F3, beats=0.5)
    playNote(A3, beats=0.25)
    playNote(F3, beats=0.25)
    rest(0.25)

    # Play a G bass pattern to build energy
    playNote(G3, beats=0.5)
    playNote(C3, beats=0.25)
    playNote(G3, beats=0.25)
    rest(0.25)

    # Return to C to ground the progression
    playNote(C3, beats=0.5)
    playNote(G3, beats=0.25)
    playNote(C3, beats=0.25)
    rest(0.5)

    playNote(C3, beats=0.5)
    playNote(G3, beats=0.25)
    playNote(C3, beats=0.25)
    rest(0.25)  # Short pause for syncopation

    # Move to F for a bit of variety and depth
    playNote(F3, beats=0.5)
    playNote(A3, beats=0.25)
    playNote(F3, beats=0.25)
    rest(0.25)

    # Play a G bass pattern to build energy
    playNote(G3, beats=0.5)
    playNote(C3, beats=0.25)
    playNote(G3, beats=0.25)
    rest(0.25)

    # Return to C to ground the progression
    playNote(C3, beats=0.5)
    playNote(G3, beats=0.25)
    playNote(C3, beats=0.25)
    rest(0.5)
    
    # Define bass notes in the key of C major
C3, E3, F3, G3, A3, B3, D3 = 48, 52, 53, 55, 57, 59, 50  # Bass notes for added groove

# Define the extended, funky bassline function
def extended_funky_bassline():
    # First C major section with a repeating bounce
    playNote(C3, beats=0.5)
    playNote(G3, beats=0.25)
    playNote(C3, beats=0.25)
    playNote(E3, beats=0.5)  # Added E for variety
    rest(0.25)

    # F major section with a new syncopated groove
    playNote(F3, beats=0.5)
    playNote(A3, beats=0.25)
    playNote(F3, beats=0.25)
    playNote(B3, beats=0.25)  # Slide up to a high note for brightness
    rest(0.25)

    # G major section with a bit more variation for energy
    playNote(G3, beats=0.5)
    playNote(C3, beats=0.25)
    playNote(D3, beats=0.25)  # Added D for a bit of movement
    playNote(G3, beats=0.5)
    rest(0.25)

    # Return to C major with an extended, dynamic finish
    playNote(C3, beats=0.5)
    playNote(G3, beats=0.25)
    playNote(C3, beats=0.25)
    playNote(E3, beats=0.25)
    playNote(G3, beats=0.25)  # Quick note for added rhythm
    rest(0.5)

# Execute the extended funky bassline
extended_funky_bassline()

# Execute the upbeat bassline
upbeat_bassline()

idata.python:
# New TunePad cell
# Define notes for an extended upbeat piano melody in the key of C major
C5, D5, E5, F5, G5, A5, B5, C6 = 72, 74, 76, 77, 79, 81, 83, 84  # Higher notes for melody
C4, G4, F4, E4 = 60, 67, 65, 64  # Lower notes for additional range and variation

# Define the extended upbeat piano melody function
def extended_upbeat_piano_melody():
    # Opening phrase with an upbeat, ascending pattern
    playNote(C5, beats=0.5)
    playNote(E5, beats=0.5)
    playNote(G5, beats=0.5)
    playNote(A5, beats=0.5)
    rest(0.5)  # Short pause

    # Next phrase with a playful descent
    playNote(G5, beats=0.5)
    playNote(F5, beats=0.5)
    playNote(D5, beats=0.5)
    playNote(C5, beats=0.5)
    rest(0.5)

    # Variation on the first phrase with more movement
    playNote(C5, beats=0.25)
    playNote(E5, beats=0.25)
    playNote(F5, beats=0.5)
    playNote(G5, beats=0.25)
    playNote(A5, beats=0.25)
    rest(0.5)

    # Adding a bright, higher section
    playNote(A5, beats=0.5)
    playNote(B5, beats=0.5)
    playNote(C6, beats=0.5)
    playNote(B5, beats=0.5)
    rest(0.5)

    # Mid-range variation with a mix of high and low notes for contrast
    playNote(G4, beats=0.5)
    playNote(E5, beats=0.5)
    playNote(C5, beats=0.5)
    playNote(F5, beats=0.5)
    rest(0.5)

    # A faster rhythm to build excitement
    playNote(G5, beats=0.25)
    playNote(A5, beats=0.25)
    playNote(C6, beats=0.25)
    playNote(B5, beats=0.25)
    rest(0.5)

    # Final phrase, resolving the melody
    playNote(F5, beats=0.5)
    playNote(E5, beats=0.5)
    playNote(D5, beats=0.5)
    playNote(C5, beats=1)  # Longer note to end the phrase

# Execute the extended upbeat piano melody
extended_upbeat_piano_melody()

name: Happiness Track
summary: A mind track for when you are in a good and upbeat mood, wanting to listen to some music that will keep you in that state of mind.
